text: Paul and Timotheus, servants of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus who are in Philippi, with overseers and ministrants;
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace to you, and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: I give thanks to my God upon all the remembrance of you,
speaker: Narrator

text: always, in every supplication of mine for you all, with joy making the supplication,
speaker: Narrator

text: for your contribution to the good news from the first day till now,
speaker: Narrator

text: having been confident of this very thing, that He who did begin in you a good work, will perform [it] till a day of Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: according as it is righteous for me to think this in behalf of you all, because of my having you in the heart, both in my bonds, and [in] the defence and confirmation of the good news, all of you being fellow-partakers with me of grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is my witness, how I long for you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: and this I pray, that your love yet more and more may abound in full knowledge, and all judgment,
speaker: Narrator

text: for your proving the things that differ, that ye may be pure and offenceless -- to a day of Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: being filled with the fruit of righteousness, that [is] through Jesus Christ, to the glory and praise of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I wish you to know, brethren, that the things concerning me, rather to an advancement of the good news have come,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that my bonds have become manifest in Christ in the whole praetorium, and to the other places -- all,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the greater part of the brethren in the Lord, having confidence by my bonds, are more abundantly bold -- fearlessly to speak the word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Certain, indeed, even through envy and contention, and certain also through good-will, do preach the Christ;
speaker: Narrator

text: the one, indeed, of rivalry the Christ do proclaim, not purely, supposing to add affliction to my bonds,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the other out of love, having known that for defence of the good news I am set:
speaker: Narrator

text: what then? in every way, whether in pretence or in truth, Christ is proclaimed -- and in this I rejoice, yea, and shall rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have known that this shall fall out to me for salvation, through your supplication, and the supply of the Spirit of Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: according to my earnest expectation and hope, that in nothing I shall be ashamed, and in all freedom, as always, also now Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether through life or through death,
speaker: Narrator

text: for to me to live [is] Christ, and to die gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if to live in the flesh [is] to me a fruit of work, then what shall I choose? I know not;
speaker: Narrator

text: for I am pressed by the two, having the desire to depart, and to be with Christ, for it is far better,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to remain in the flesh is more necessary on your account,
speaker: Narrator

text: and of this being persuaded, I have known that I shall remain and continue with you all, to your advancement and joy of the faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: that your boasting may abound in Christ Jesus in me through my presence again to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only worthily of the good news of the Christ conduct ye yourselves, that, whether having come and seen you, whether being absent I may hear of the things concerning you, that ye stand fast in one spirit, with one soul, striving together for the faith of the good news,
speaker: Narrator

text: and not terrified in anything by those opposing, which to them indeed is a token of destruction, and to you of salvation, and that from God;
speaker: Narrator

text: because to you it was granted, on behalf of Christ, not only to believe in him, but also on behalf of him to suffer;
speaker: Narrator

text: the same conflict having, such as ye saw in me, and now hear of in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If, then, any exhortation [is] in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of spirit, if any bowels and mercies,
speaker: Narrator

text: fulfil ye my joy, that ye may mind the same thing -- having the same love -- of one soul -- minding the one thing,
speaker: Narrator

text: nothing in rivalry or vain-glory, but in humility of mind one another counting more excellent than yourselves --
speaker: Narrator

text: each not to your own look ye, but each also to the things of others.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, let this mind be in you that [is] also in Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: who, being in the form of God, thought [it] not robbery to be equal to God,
speaker: Narrator

text: but did empty himself, the form of a servant having taken, in the likeness of men having been made,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in fashion having been found as a man, he humbled himself, having become obedient unto death -- death even of a cross,
speaker: Narrator

text: wherefore, also, God did highly exalt him, and gave to him a name that [is] above every name,
speaker: Narrator

text: that in the name of Jesus every knee may bow -- of heavenlies, and earthlies, and what are under the earth --
speaker: Narrator

text: and every tongue may confess that Jesus Christ [is] Lord, to the glory of God the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that, my beloved, as ye always obey, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, with fear and trembling your own salvation work out,
speaker: Narrator

text: for God it is who is working in you both to will and to work for His good pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: All things do without murmurings and reasonings,
speaker: Narrator

text: that ye may become blameless and harmless, children of God, unblemished in the midst of a generation crooked and perverse, among whom ye do appear as luminaries in the world,
speaker: Narrator

text: the word of life holding forth, for rejoicing to me in regard to a day of Christ, that not in vain did I run, nor in vain did I labour;
speaker: Narrator

text: but if also I am poured forth upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I rejoice and joy with you all,
speaker: Narrator

text: because of this do ye also rejoice and joy with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I hope, in the Lord Jesus, Timotheus to send quickly to you, that I also may be of good spirit, having known the things concerning you,
speaker: Narrator

text: for I have no one like-minded, who sincerely for the things concerning you will care,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the whole seek their own things, not the things of the Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the proof of him ye know, that as a child [serveth] a father, with me he did serve in regard to the good news;
speaker: Narrator

text: him, indeed, therefore, I hope to send, when I may see through the things concerning me -- immediately;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I trust in the Lord that I myself also shall quickly come.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I thought [it] necessary Epaphroditus -- my brother, and fellow-workman, and fellow-soldier, and your apostle and servant to my need -- to send unto you,
speaker: Narrator

text: seeing he was longing after you all, and in heaviness, because ye heard that he ailed,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he also ailed nigh to death, but God did deal kindly with him, and not with him only, but also with me, that sorrow upon sorrow I might not have.
speaker: Narrator

text: The more eagerly, therefore, I did send him, that having seen him again ye may rejoice, and I may be the less sorrowful;
speaker: Narrator

text: receive him, therefore, in the Lord, with all joy, and hold such in honour,
speaker: Narrator

text: because on account of the work of the Christ he drew near to death, having hazarded the life that he might fill up your deficiency of service unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: As to the rest, my brethren, rejoice in the Lord; the same things to write to you to me indeed is not tiresome, and for you [is] sure;
speaker: Narrator

text: look to the dogs, look to the evil-workers, look to the concision;
speaker: Narrator

text: for we are the circumcision, who by the Spirit are serving God, and glorying in Christ Jesus, and in flesh having no trust,
speaker: Narrator

text: though I also have [cause of] trust in flesh. If any other one doth think to have trust in flesh, I more;
speaker: Narrator

text: circumcision on the eighth day! of the race of Israel! of the tribe of Benjamin! a Hebrew of Hebrews! according to law a Pharisee!
speaker: Narrator

text: according to zeal persecuting the assembly! according to righteousness that is in law becoming blameless!
speaker: Narrator

text: But what things were to me gains, these I have counted, because of the Christ, loss;
speaker: Narrator

text: yes, indeed, and I count all things to be loss, because of the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, because of whom of the all things I suffered loss, and do count them to be refuse, that Christ I may gain, and be found in him,
speaker: Narrator

text: not having my righteousness, which [is] of law, but that which [is] through faith of Christ -- the righteousness that is of God by the faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: to know him, and the power of his rising again, and the fellowship of his sufferings, being conformed to his death,
speaker: Narrator

text: if anyhow I may attain to the rising again of the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that I did already obtain, or have been already perfected; but I pursue, if also I may lay hold of that for which also I was laid hold of by the Christ Jesus;
speaker: Narrator

text: brethren, I do not reckon myself to have laid hold; and one thing -- the things behind indeed forgetting, and to the things before stretching forth --
speaker: Narrator

text: to the mark I pursue for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: As many, therefore, as [are] perfect -- let us think this, and if [in] anything ye think otherwise, this also shall God reveal to you,
speaker: Narrator

text: but to what we have come -- by the same rule walk, the same thing think;
speaker: Narrator

text: become followers together of me, brethren, and observe those thus walking, according as ye have us -- a pattern;
speaker: Narrator

text: for many walk of whom many times I told you -- and now also weeping tell -- the enemies of the cross of the Christ!
speaker: Narrator

text: whose end [is] destruction, whose god [is] the belly, and whose glory [is] in their shame, who the things on earth are minding.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our citizenship is in the heavens, whence also a Saviour we await -- the Lord Jesus Christ --
speaker: Narrator

text: who shall transform the body of our humiliation to its becoming conformed to the body of his glory, according to the working of his power, even to subject to himself the all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, my brethren, beloved and longed for, my joy and crown, so stand ye in the Lord, beloved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Euodia I exhort, and Syntyche I exhort, to be of the same mind in the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I ask also thee, genuine yoke-fellow, be assisting those women who in the good news did strive along with me, with Clement also, and the others, my fellow-workers, whose names [are] in the book of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice in the Lord always; again I will say, rejoice;
speaker: Narrator

text: let your forbearance be known to all men; the Lord [is] near;
speaker: Narrator

text: for nothing be anxious, but in everything by prayer, and by supplication, with thanksgiving, let your requests be made known unto God;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the peace of God, that is surpassing all understanding, shall guard your hearts and your thoughts in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: As to the rest, brethren, as many things as are true, as many as [are] grave, as many as [are] righteous, as many as [are] pure, as many as [are] lovely, as many as [are] of good report, if any worthiness, and if any praise, these things think upon;
speaker: Narrator

text: the things that also ye did learn, and receive, and hear, and saw in me, those do, and the God of the peace shall be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I rejoiced in the Lord greatly, that now at length ye flourished again in caring for me, for which also ye were caring, and lacked opportunity;
speaker: Narrator

text: not that in respect of want I say [it], for I did learn in the things in which I am -- to be content;
speaker: Narrator

text: I have known both to be abased, and I have known to abound; in everything and in all things I have been initiated, both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to be in want.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all things I have strength, in Christ's strengthening me;
speaker: Narrator

text: but ye did well, having communicated with my tribulation;
speaker: Narrator

text: and ye have known, even ye Philippians, that in the beginning of the good news when I went forth from Macedonia, no assembly did communicate with me in regard to giving and receiving except ye only;
speaker: Narrator

text: because also in Thessalonica, both once and again to my need ye sent;
speaker: Narrator

text: not that I seek after the gift, but I seek after the fruit that is overflowing to your account;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I have all things, and abound; I am filled, having received from Epaphroditus the things from you -- an odour of a sweet smell -- a sacrifice acceptable, well-pleasing to God:
speaker: Narrator

text: and my God shall supply all your need, according to His riches in glory in Christ Jesus;
speaker: Narrator

text: and to God, even our Father, [is] the glory -- to the ages of the ages. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute ye every saint in Christ Jesus; there salute you the brethren with me;
speaker: Narrator

text: there salute you all the saints, and specially those of Caesar's house;
speaker: Narrator

text: the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [is] with you all. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
